cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to track northwest, cross the northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, enter the central Gulf Tuesday, make U.S. Gulf Coast landfall (LA-MS area) early Wednesday, then arc northeast across AL/GA into the Tennessee Valley by Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near Louisiana–Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, then northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas to Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≈3%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts late Thursday; otherwise breezy conditions below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Georgia coast from Zeta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain late Thursday into Friday, with localized heavier bursts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated, short-lived tornadoes possible inland across southeast Georgia as the remnant core crosses the state.
